business.headline: Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

How credit cards fuelled India's Diwali shopping partyA new survey has revealed how Indians turned to credit cards for high-value festive buys this Diwali, planning purchases smartly around cashback offers, no-cost EMIs and online deals.

Gold, silver prices are falling. Should you buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are slipping as global optimism rises and profit-taking kicks in. Experts explain what's driving the fall and whether buyers should wait before investing.

Hospital bills are rising. Here's how to make your health insurance smarterAs medical inflation pushes treatment and hospital costs higher, insurers are reworking pricing and policies. Here's how flexible plans, wellness incentives, and smart choices can help you keep your cover affordable.

Supreme Court allows Centre to reconsider Vodafone Idea's plea on extra AGR duesFor Vodafone Idea, which is already burdened with mounting liabilities and ongoing financial strain, the top court's nod gives the Centre scope to reassess the dues, potentially opening a narrow path for relief or renegotiation.

Why modern parents are building 'Gold Vaults' instead of buying jewelleryParents are rethinking how they gift gold, moving beyond jewellery to create long-term "Gold Vaults" for their children. Here's how this modern plan turns tradition into a smart, inflation-proof investment.

Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is the stock market rising today?At 10:33 am, the NSE Nifty50 surged 171.25 points to 25,966.40, while the BSE Sensex jumped 575.03 points to 84,786.91. Broader market indices also traded higher, mirroring the upbeat sentiment on Dalal Street.

Gold, silver prices continue to fall: What's making precious metals lose their shine?Gold and silver prices are slipping after a strong two-month rally. Here's why the dollar's strength, easing tensions, and Fed expectations are cooling off investor appetite for bullion.

Sensex, Nifty rise as US trade deal hopes lift market moodAt 9:30 am, the BSE Sensex surged 306.28 points to 84,518.16, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 97.55 points to 25,892.70. Most broader market indices also traded higher in early deals, even as market volatility showed a mild uptick.

Luxury vs affordable housing: What homebuyers prefer during festive seasonThe festive months are traditionally seen as an auspicious time to buy homes. But as real estate sentiment rises across cities, one question stands out — are buyers chasing luxury spaces or choosing affordability amid rising costs?

LIC refutes Washington Post report on $3.9-billion Adani investment planA Washington Post report claimed that the Finance Ministry expedited a proposal directing nearly $3.9 billion (Rs 33,000 crore) in investments from the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) into the Adani Group. The life insurance major rejected the claims as baseless.
Writing a will? These common mistakes can land it in courtFrom Bollywood families to neighbourhood households, inheritance battles have shown that even the most watertight wills can spring leaks.

Reliance says it will comply with new US, Western sanctions on Russian oilThe oil-to-retail behemoth said that it is assessing the implications of restrictions announced by the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States on crude oil imports from Russia and the export of refined products to Europe.

No trade deals with a gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talksThis special report covers Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's firm message on India's approach to international trade negotiations, particularly regarding the United States. Speaking at the Berlin Global Dialogue, Mr. Goyal made it clear that India will not be rushed into agreements. He stated, 'we do not do deals in a hurry, and we do not go ahead and sign any deals with deadlines or with a gun to our head'. The minister emphasized that for India, trade deals are not merely about tariffs or market access but are long-term partnerships built on trust and mutual respect between nations. This stance comes amid ongoing trade discussions with both the US and the European Union, where India is advocating for fair and equitable agreements that benefit its businesses and economy in the long run.

Don't do deals with gun to our head: Piyush Goyal on trade talks with USIndia is exploring newer markets to reduce the impact of high tariffs and ensure fair trade terms for its exporters, said Piyush Goyal. He noted that India's approach is guided by strategy and self-interest rather than external pressure.
Sensex closes 320 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; HUL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 344.52 points to close at 84,211.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.25 points to end at 25,795.15.

Have you been investing in mutual funds the wrong way all this time?Experts say that most investors rely only on absolute returns while judging a mutual fund's performance. They focus on the number showing how much profit they've made, without understanding the factors behind those returns.

US maize import talks rattle Indian farmers as prices fall below MSPReports suggest that if the trade deal goes through and American maize starts entering Indian markets — prices could crash, and farmers may face huge losses.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: Why the stock market is falling todayThe fall came as investors engaged in profit booking following recent gains. After sustained upward movements, it is common for markets to experience short-term corrections as participants secure returns.

Gold ETFs vs physical gold: What smart investors are looking at, explains expertGold may be timeless, but the way Indians invest in it is changing fast. With rising awareness of hidden costs, gold ETFs are gaining traction as a smarter, hassle-free alternative.

entertainment.headline: HAQ trailer: Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi reignite faith vs justice debate The makers of Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam-starrer released the trailer of 'HAQ'. The film is described as a love story, and seemingly a private dispute between a husband and wife shifts to a rousing debate on a provocative topic that begs a solution even today.

Emraan Hashmi reacts to his viral Ba***ds scene: Never imagined it would blow up Emraan Hashmi addressed the widespread attention surrounding his cameo in Aryan Khan's directorial debut, explores changing fan perceptions, and shares his thoughts as he promotes his upcoming film 'HAQ'.
Jamtara 2 actor Sachin Ganesh Chandwade dies by suicide 'Jamtara 2' actor Sachin Ganesh Chandwade died by suicide on Bhai Dooj. The actor was found dead in his Pune residence.

Ahaan Pandey's Saiyaara completes 100 days, mother Deanne shares gratitude post Actor Ahaan Pandey's mother Deanne Pandey shared an emotional post as 'Saiyaara' completed 100 days in theatres. She expressed heartfelt gratitude towards fans for their love and support on her son's debut film.

Actor through elder brother had director replace me in Tezaab: Aditya Pancholi Actor Aditya Pancholi says he was replaced in 'Tezaab' due to industry power play. He claims there are deeper issues of favouritism and manipulation beyond nepotism in Bollywood.

Samantha begins Maa Inti Bangaram shooting, Raj Nidimoru gives first clap Samantha began shooting for her upcoming film 'Maa Inti Bangaram'. The actor kick-started the shoot with a mahurat ceremony where Raj Nidimoru gave the first clap.

Dharmendra told underworld he had truck-loads in Punjab to fight with him: Report Actor-director Satyajeet Puri shared how Dharmendra fearlessly warned the underworld. This rare anecdote reveals the veteran's legendary courage and influence beyond films.

Ajay Devgn admits he used to be heavy drinker, now prefers Rs 60,000 premium malt Ajay Devgn opened up about his transformation from being a heavy drinker to adopting a more moderate approach, sharing personal experiences and reflections on the factors that influenced his choices.

OTT this week: Baaghi 4, Kantara: Chapter 1 to Idli Kadai; When and where to watch This week promises an exciting lineup of new films and shows on OTT. So sit back, relax, grab your popcorn, and get ready to pick your next favourite watch.

Ram Nath Kovind becomes 1st Indian President to feature in devotional film For the first time in India's history, a former President and his family participated in a devotional film, reciting the Namokar Mantra, marking a significant cultural moment.

Rajamouli, Prabhas, Rana reunite as they discuss favourite scenes from Baahubali In anticipation of the theatrical release of 'Baahubali: The Epic', director SS Rajamouli gathers for a conversation with lead actors Prabhas and Rana Daggubati. They revisit their experiences and the most memorable moments from the landmark franchise, sharing insights and personal highlights with audiences.

BTS' Kim Taehyung steals spotlight at Vogue World: Hollywood; see pics BTS' Kim Taehyung stole attention at Vogue World: Hollywood, blending Korean tradition with red-carpet sophistication. His look wasn't just fashion, it was a global moment celebrating culture, class, and charisma.

Kantara Chapter 1 OTT release: When and where to watch Rishab Shetty's epic 'Kantara: A Legend Chapter 1' OTT release date announced: The Rishab Shetty film will be available in Kannada, with dubbed versions in Tamil, Telugu, and Malayalam, while the Hindi version will arrive later for online audiences.

Dia Mirza, Rahul Bhat in Indo-German filmmaker Kanwal Sethi's untitled romance Actors Rahul Bhat and Dia Mirza will feature in an untitled love story directed by Kanwal Sethi. The film is an exploration of love, based on emotional and cultural landscapes.

Sandhya Mridul reveals losing work over follower count, seeks industry support Actor Sandhya Mridul discusses the growing emphasis on social media metrics in the entertainment industry and its effect on artists' careers.

Yami Gautam reacts to being labelled nationalist: Was called underrated earlier Actor Yami Gautam, at the trailer launch of her film 'HAQ' in Mumbai, spoke about her approach to storytelling, her refusal to accept labels, and the importance of audience engagement. The film, inspired by the Supreme Court's Shah Bano case judgement, features Yami alongside Emraan Hashmi.

Vadh 2 release date out: Neena Gupta, Sanjay Mishra return in spiritual sequel 'Vadh 2', a spiritual sequel to 'Vadh' (2022) explores intense emotions and moral dilemmas. The film, featuring Neena Gupta and Sanjay Mishra, is scheduled for a theatrical release on February 6, 2026.

Mr. Shahid Kapoor please handle your wife: Mira Rajput trolled for cracker ban plea Bollywood actor Shahid Kapoor's wife, Mira Rajput Kapoor, has been trolled by an X user, for her appeal to all on social media to avoid crackers because they cause pollution

Sonal Chauhan confirms role in Mirzapur The Film, calls it an iconic project Actor Sonal Chauhan joined the cast of 'Mirzapur: The Film'. She made the announcement on social media, while expressing gratitude towards Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani.

general news.headline: Delhi woman's father confesses to plotting attack to frame accused, she brought acidIn a shocking twist to the acid attack case involving a 20-year-old Delhi University student, the survivor's father confessed to plotting the attack to frame the main accused, and the survivor herself brought acid, sources told India Today TV.

After Bihar, SIR in 12 states and UTs in phase 2; to cover 51 crore votersChief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar has announced the rollout of the second phase of the Special Intensive Revision to update electoral rolls across 12 states and Union Territories. The initiative follows the successful completion of the first phase in Bihar, aiming to ensure accurate and inclusive voter lists nationwide.

Cyclone Montha live: Immediate evacuation ordered in coastal Andhra, heavy rain continuesA cyclonic storm named Montha brewing over the Bay of Bengal is expected to intensify into a Severe Cyclonic Storm by the morning of October 28, according to the IMD. The system is projected to make landfall between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam, around Kakinada, by the evening or night of October 28. The storm is likely to bring wind speeds of 90–100 km/h, with gusts reaching up to 110 km/h, along with heavy rainfall across coastal Andhra Pradesh and adjoining Odisha. Authorities have urged residents in vulnerable areas to stay alert. Stay with indiatoday.com for the latest updates –

Indian-origin woman raped in UK race crime, suspect held after manhuntA 32-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old Indian-origin woman in a racially aggravated attack in the UK.  The police had released CCTV footage of the suspect as part of a public appeal for information and confirmed that they are treating the crime 'as a racially aggravated attack'.

Why Kerala has broken ranks with Bengal, TN to join PM Shri, NEP | ExplainedOnce a vocal critic of New Education Policy (NEP) 2020, Kerala has now moved away from West Bengal and Tamil Nadu to sign the PM SHRI MoU. What made the CPM-led LDF government to move away from other Opposition-ruled states to implement the NEP?

Now 'vote chori' game in 12 states: Opposition's attack on poll body over SIRThe Congress has criticised the Election Commission's decision to expand the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls to 12 states, alleging that the move was politically motivated and premature while related matters remain before the Supreme Court.

Women's World Cup: Shafali Verma replaces injured Pratika Rawal before semifinalThe Indian team has added Shafali Verma to the squad after she was approved as the replacement for Pratika Rawal on Monday, October 27.

Indian-origin woman in US slashes husband's neck over messy houseA 44-year-old Indian-origin teaching assistant was arrested in Charlotte, North Carolina, for allegedly slashing her husband's neck during a dispute over household chores. She claimed it was accidental. The woman is now under electronic surveillance.
Pakistan's Kutch diversion?Sixty years ago, Pakistan's first military dictator launched a military thrust in Kutch. Could history repeat itself?

No hurdle for SIR in Bengal: Poll body chief on Trinamool leaders' bloodbath threatsChief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar said there will be no obstacles in conducting the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the voters' list in West Bengal despite opposition and threats by the Trinamool Congress.

US announces new entry, exit regulations for foreigners, Green Card holdersThe US will require all non-citizens, including Green Card holders, to undergo facial recognition and biometric checks at all entry and exit points from December 26, 2025. The system aims to curb visa overstays and identity fraud. Experts, however, warn it may disproportionately affect minorities and raise privacy concerns, calling it a step toward pervasive surveillance.

Kantara Chapter 1 OTT release: When and where to watch Rishab Shetty's epic'Kantara: A Legend Chapter 1' OTT release date announced: The Rishab Shetty film will be available in Kannada, with dubbed versions in Tamil, Telugu, and Malayalam, while the Hindi version will arrive later for online audiences.

Rohit Sharma 3.0: Fitter at 38, ready to run marathons againIn Australia, Rohit Sharma showed that he was ready to grind it out to secure a place for the 2027 ODI World Cup. At 38, is Rohit once again ready to return to his old role of an accumulator?
Jamtara 2 actor Sachin Ganesh Chandwade dies by suicide'Jamtara 2' actor Sachin Ganesh Chandwade died by suicide on Bhai Dooj. The actor was found dead in his Pune residence.

It was a general meme: Kangana Ranaut regrets 2020 farmers' protest tweetKangana Ranaut in 2020 had posted on X, misidentifying Mahinder Kaur as Bilkis Dadi, one of the faces of the anti-CAA protests at Shaheen Bagh, and alleged that the woman was "available for Rs 100" to attend demonstrations.

Two crashes in 30 minutes: US loses fighter jet, navy chopper in South China SeaTwo US Navy aircraft crashed within 30 minutes of one another in the South China Sea during separate operations. China said the crashes occurred during a military exercise. The US Navy has launched a probe into the causes of the crashes in the geopolitically sensitive region, with some alleging foul play.

Snack tourism is proving that a good bar of chocolate is worth crossing borders forFrom tasting Swiss chocolates straight from the Laderach and Lindt boutiques to hunting down Japan's limited-edition KitKats, people are literally crossing borders for edible experiences that connect them to local culture.

3 house visits, final voter rolls by Feb 2026: How SIR will take place in 12 statesThe Election Commission has announced the rollout of the second phase of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls across 12 states, aiming to finalise the updated voter lists by February 2026.

Forensics student uses LPG agent ex-lover's help to kill partner, set home ablazeThe victim was killed allegedly by his live-in partner and two others, who later set his flat ablaze to pass the murder off as an accident. What was initially thought to be an air-conditioner blast was, in fact, a carefully orchestrated cover-up.

Delhi AQI data gap exposed: Only 11 of 39 stations captured toxic Diwali nightIndia Today's analysis of the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) data from October 20 to 21, 2025, only 11 recorded Air Quality Index (AQI) readings through the night, while data from 28 stations went missing during peak pollution hours.

No botox till 30, says Hailey Bieber. Does age really matter?Hailey Bieber recently shared her take on botox. For those truly looking at it, this one is for you. We asked the expert if holding off treatments could be of any help, actually.

Big win for Bengal as Supreme Court directs resumption of MGNREGA after 3 yearsThe Supreme Court directed the Centre to resume MGNREGA, a rural employment scheme, in West Bengal, ending an over three-year-old legal battle. The order follows the dismissal of the Centre's plea challenging a Calcutta High Court order that directed the resumption of the scheme.

Rezang La: When 118 Indians stood against an armyOn the freezing ridge of Rezang La, November 18, 1962, 118 men, mostly Ahirs, of Charlie Company faced thousands of Chinese soldiers. Cut off, outnumbered, and forsaken, they chose valour over survival

YouTuber under fire for India cow dung festival video. His 'not racist' defenceThe video, which has garnered five million views on X, drew criticism from social media users who accused 25-year-old YouTuber Tyler Oliveira of mocking a tradition and ignoring its religious significance.

sports.headline: Juventus sack Igor Tudor after winless run, appoint Brambilla as interim coach Juventus have dismissed head coach Igor Tudor following a series of poor results. The club hopes interim coach Massimo Brambilla can reverse the team's fortunes amid growing pressure.

BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla wishes Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after spleen injury BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla wished Shreyas Iyer a speedy recovery after the batter suffered a laceration to his spleen while taking a stunning catch in the third ODI against Australia. The BCCI confirmed he is medically stable and recovering in Sydney.

Josh Hazlewood sends Ashes warning to England: Wouldn't sledge any of our batters Josh Hazlewood has sent a warning to England ahead of the Ashes series, telling them that they shouldn't look to sledge the Australian players. The Ashes last time around saw the controversial Jonny Bairstow stumping incident at Lord's, which led to tensions between both teams.

D Gukesh returns to Goa as World Champion to lead India at FIDE World Cup 2025 World Champion D Gukesh is set to lead India at the FIDE World Cup 2025 in Goa, a place close to his heart from his early chess days, marking a special homecoming for the prodigy.

Women's World Cup: Shafali Verma replaces injured Pratika Rawal before semifinal The Indian team has added Shafali Verma to the squad after she was approved as the replacement for Pratika Rawal on Monday, October 27.

Suryakumar's form not a concern, okay to fail when fearless: Gautam Gambhir India head coach Gautam Gambhir is not concerned about Suryakumar Yadav's poor run in international cricket. Gambhir said that it was okay to fail while playing fearless cricket.

Mourinho has the last laugh: Turkey moves to punish 371 referees in betting scandal Turkey's football federation has disciplined 371 referees for betting violations. This scandal highlights deep-rooted corruption and raises questions about football governance in Turkey.

Watch: Rohit Sharma returns to Mumbai in style to chorus of Hitman chants Rohit Sharma got a hero's welcome as he returned to Mumbai after his fine performance in the Australia series. Rohit scored a hundred and a fifty during the ODI series down under.

Usman Khawaja backs Marnus Labuschagne, tips Renshaw to make comeback Usman Khawaja backed Marnus Labuschagne to be part of the Australia team and tipped his Queensland opening partner Matt Renshaw to make a return the side for the Ashes. Australia are looking to find a partner for Khawaja at the top of the order.

Who replaces Pratika Rawal? Ex-cricketers weigh in ahead of Australia semis India's opening batter Pratika Rawal is ruled out of the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final due to injury. The team faces a critical selection decision that could impact their chances against Australia.

Beating stigma: Kannagi Nagar's Karthika shines with Kabaddi gold Hailing from Kannagi Nagar, Karthika has made the whole Tamil Nadu proud with her performance as the vice-captain of the U-18 women's kabaddi team during the youth Asian Games. India clinched gold in women's kabaddi with Karthika playing a big role in the win.

India clinched gold in women's kabaddi with Karthika playing a big role in the win.

Vinicius's Clasico meltdown: Should Xabi be worried about his Real Madrid exit?Vinicius Jr's fiery El Clasico debut ended in drama as he reportedly threatened to leave after being subbed off. Xabi Alonso, however, remained unfazed, keeping his focus firmly on Real Madrid's win.

Rohit Sharma 3.0: Fitter at 38, ready to run marathons againIn Australia, Rohit Sharma showed that he was ready to grind it out to secure a place for the 2027 ODI World Cup. At 38, is Rohit once again ready to return to his old role of an accumulator?

Everyone is just trying to push Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli down: AB de VilliersAB de Villiers has slammed the critics of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli after the duo excelled for India during the final ODI against Australia. De Villiers said that people are constantly trying to pull down the Indian star duo.
AUS vs IND: Indian-origin spinner roped in to replace Adam Zampa in T20I seriesAustralia have named Tanveer Sangha as Adam Zampa's replacement for the upcoming T20I series against India.

Mitchell Marsh has a route back for Australia's Ashes squad: Andrew McDonaldAustralia coach Andrew McDonald has stated that the door is firmly open on Mitchell Marsh's return to the Test squad for the upcoming Ashes series. Marsh last played a Test match in 2024.

Australia players provided police escort in Mumbai after Indore incidentAustralian women cricketers were given police escorts in Navi Mumbai following harassment in Indore. The incident has led to tightened security measures to protect players during the World Cup.

How Xabi Alonso's gutsy tactics helped Real Madrid cut through Barcelona's fading edgeXabi Alonso's first El Clasico as Real Madrid manager was a tactical statement wrapped in nostalgia. Calm on the touchline and bold in his calls, he outwitted Barcelona to deliver Madrid's sweetest revenge yet.

PAK vs SA: Pakistan coach reveals Babar Azam's batting position on T20I returnBabar Azam is set to return to Pakistan's T20I team, batting at number three against South Africa. This move aims to strengthen Pakistan's top order ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Ankle injury ends Pratika Rawal's World Cup journey before Australia semifinal: ReportIndia's World Cup campaign has reportedly hit a hurdle, with opener Pratika Rawal likely to miss the semi-final against Australia. The in-form batter twisted her ankle during the final league match against Bangladesh.
IND vs SA: Temba Bavuma is back, South Africa name 15-man squad for India TestsSouth Africa have named their squad for the upcoming Test series against India with Temba Bavuma returning as captain.

PV Sindhu ends 2025 season early after failing to recover from foot injuryTwo-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu, 30, confirmed on Monday that she was ending her season early. Sindhu, who reached the quarterfinal of the World Championships in August, has been recovering from a foot injury.

Hungry for runs, Prithvi Shaw hits 2nd fastest double-hundred in Ranji TrophyPrithvi Shaw scored a blistering double century in only his second match for Maharashtra. This innings marks one of the fastest double hundreds in Ranji Trophy history, raising expectations around his domestic form.

I deserved better: Out of favour stars hit out at chief selector Ajit AgarkarIndia batters Karun Nair and Ajinkya Rahane hit out at chief selector Ajit Agarkar after hitting respective hundreds in the Ranji Trophy.

Shreyas Iyer medically stable, recovering well in Sydney after rib injury: BCCIShreyas Iyer remains in Sydney's ICU after sustaining a laceration to the spleen during the third ODI against Australia. Medical teams are closely monitoring his recovery, with his return to cricket uncertain.

Shreyas Iyer In ICU! Star Cricketer Suffers Internal Bleeding After Horror On-Field InjuryThis special report focuses on Indian ODI Vice-Captain Shreyas Iyer, who has been admitted to the ICU in a Sydney hospital. The cricketer is suffering from internal bleeding caused by a ribcage injury sustained while taking a catch in the third ODI against Australia. Sources within the BCCI are indicating that 'this is an internal bleeding that he's suffering from.' The report details the moments leading to the injury, the swift action by the medical team, and the potential impact on his career and India's upcoming fixtures, including the ODI series against South Africa which he is now set to miss. Iyer is expected to remain under close medical observation for at least a week before he can travel back to India.

Don't scare Rohit and Virat with age talk: Ex-selector sends stern message to BCCIFormer selector Kris Srikkanth insists Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should not be judged by age as they prepare for the 2027 World Cup. Rohit and Kohli stitched a match-winning 168-run stand in the third ODI against Australia in Sydney on Saturday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
